location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Howell Beynon, Jeypour [Jaipur] to Colonel Lewis Pelly, Agent to the Governor-General for Rajpootana [Rājasthān]

mods.abstract: Letter regarding Lewis Pelly's forthcoming visit to Jeypour and arrangements for greeting the Maharaja. The letter also submits a request from the Maharaja for his sons to be permitted to sit at the Durbar, but not to be included in the number of followers attending.The letter concludes by referring to a telegram about the Baroda Commissioner which was published in the Times and informing Pelly that the Nawab had written to him to say that Sir Richard Meade had requested he (the Nawab) meet the Commissioner in Bombay.
